simulated_ratings.title: World of Apu, The (Apur Sansar) (1959)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tender, humane, and quietly devastating

simulated_ratings.title: Battleship Potemkin (1925)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Technically thrilling and politically blunt

simulated_ratings.title: Official Story, The (La historia oficial) (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A piercing, humane unraveling of complicity that rattled me long after.

simulated_ratings.title: Babette's Feast (Babettes gæstebud) (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A gentle, soulful feast of grace that warmed me more than I expected.

simulated_ratings.title: Great Dictator, The (1940)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sharp, humane satire that balances laughter and fury with timeless bite.

simulated_ratings.title: Harakiri (Seppuku) (1962)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A ruthless, perfectly constructed takedown of hollow honor that left me stunned.

simulated_ratings.title: Song of the Little Road (Pather Panchali) (1955)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Unforced, compassionate storytelling that seeped into me like a memory.

simulated_ratings.title: Wages of Fear, The (Salaire de la peur, Le) (1953)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweaty-palmed tension with real moral grit—I was glued to it.

simulated_ratings.title: Godfather, The (1972)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Operatic, precise, and chilling

simulated_ratings.title: Wild Strawberries (Smultronstället) (1957)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A tender reckoning with time and regret that quietly broke me.

simulated_ratings.title: Children of Paradise (Les enfants du paradis) (1945)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lyrical and grand, if a touch distant, but gorgeously alive.

simulated_ratings.title: Butterfly (La lengua de las mariposas) (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, delicate coming-of-age shadowed by politics that cut deep at the end.

simulated_ratings.title: Nights of Cabiria (Notti di Cabiria, Le) (1957)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Heartbreaking resilience rendered with such grace I couldn’t shake it.

simulated_ratings.title: City of God (Cidade de Deus) (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Breathless, visceral storytelling that balances style with a bruising soul.

simulated_ratings.title: M (1931)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Unnervingly modern—taut, morally thorny, and impossible to turn away from.

simulated_ratings.title: Kid, The (1921)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest, funny, and tender

simulated_ratings.title: City Lights (1931)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Romance and slapstick fused into pure feeling

simulated_ratings.title: Best of Youth, The (La meglio gioventù) (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Expansive and intimate, with lives that felt lived-in despite the sprawl.

simulated_ratings.title: Don't Hug Me, I'm Scared II: Time (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Inventive and unsettling—darkly funny in a way that lingers.

simulated_ratings.title: Landscape in the Mist (Topio stin omichli) (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Hypnotic melancholy that drifted over me like a cold fog.

simulated_ratings.title: Ikiru (1952)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Humanist and piercing—a quiet roar about meaning that lingers.

simulated_ratings.title: Home (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Intimate and sincere, if a bit uneven, with moments that quietly resonated.

simulated_ratings.title: Schindler's List (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sober, harrowing, and carefully crafted

simulated_ratings.title: Seventh Seal, The (Sjunde inseglet, Det) (1957)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Philosophical and stark, engaging more intellectually than emotionally for me.

simulated_ratings.title: General, The (1926)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Impeccable physical filmmaking—clever, propulsive, and charming.

simulated_ratings.title: Come and See (Idi i smotri) (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A visceral howl against war that left me shaken and speechless.

Life Is Beautiful (La Vita è bella) (1997)

simulated_ratings.title: Lost in Translation (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A hushed, melancholy drift through alienation and a fleeting bond that lingers.

simulated_ratings.title: Garden State (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Touches of honesty drowned by twee affectation and tidy epiphanies.

simulated_ratings.title: She's So Lovely (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Raw, unstable longing with jagged edges that felt alive if uneven.

simulated_ratings.title: The Salt of the Earth (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Staggering images and humane witness that humbled me.

simulated_ratings.title: Amelie (Fabuleux destin d'Amélie Poulain, Le) (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Charming confection whose whimsy delights even as the sugar coats too thickly.

simulated_ratings.title: Time Code (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The formal stunt fascinates more than it moves, but the experiment sings at times.

simulated_ratings.title: Life and Times of Hank Greenberg, The (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Affectionate, insightful portrait with a resonant undercurrent of identity and grit.

simulated_ratings.title: Satan's Tango (Sátántangó) (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Hypnotic and grueling, a bleak trance that seeped into me.

simulated_ratings.title: American Beauty (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slick and watchable, but its suburban revelation now feels self-satisfied.

simulated_ratings.title: The Key to Reserva (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A witty, loving cinephile game that tickled me start to finish.

simulated_ratings.title: Inside Out (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Inventive, empathetic storytelling that made emotion feel tactile.

simulated_ratings.title: Forrest Gump (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Engaging folk tale with a manipulative gloss I couldn’t fully swallow.

simulated_ratings.title: Into the Wild (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lyrical and sincere, its yearning moves even as its romanticism grates.

simulated_ratings.title: Youth in Revolt (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Smirking charm with flashes of wit, but it curdles into glibness.

simulated_ratings.title: Snow Falling on Cedars (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gorgeous melancholy wrapped around a case that left me a bit cold.

simulated_ratings.title: Where the Wild Things Are (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A tender, melancholy ode to unruly childhood that felt honest.

simulated_ratings.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets (1949)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Deliciously sharp and wicked, executed with effortless poise.

simulated_ratings.title: MAID-DROID (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Exploitative and icky, with ideas I wanted to shut out.

simulated_ratings.title: Life Is Beautiful (La Vita è bella) (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gentle, loving intent that both moved me and made me wince.

simulated_ratings.title: Royal Tenenbaums, The (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Deadpan melancholy and meticulous craft that warmed me despite the archness.

simulated_ratings.title: Igby Goes Down (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Acerbic and aimless in equal measure, intermittently affecting.

simulated_ratings.title: DiG! (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Chaotic, compulsive portrait of ego and art that crackled.

simulated_ratings.title: (500) Days of Summer (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cleverly framed and bittersweet, if a touch too pleased with itself.

simulated_ratings.title: Fall (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy romance that never convinces beyond its fantasy.

simulated_ratings.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Inventive heartbreak that burrowed in and glowed.

simulated_ratings.title: Calvary (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A dark, humane reckoning that left me quietly shaken.

simulated_ratings.title: Toy Story (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Spry, inventive, and warm—pure play with a beating heart.

simulated_ratings.title: Get on the Bus (1996)

simulated_ratings.title: South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Vulgar, blistering satire that hits more than it misses.

simulated_ratings.title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (2009)

simulated_ratings.title: Titanic (1997)

simulated_ratings.title: Seven Up! (1964)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Simple premise, profound humanity—time’s weight begins to gather.

simulated_ratings.title: The Limb Salesman (2004)

simulated_ratings.title: Dirty Dancing (1987)

simulated_ratings.title: Drop Dead Gorgeous (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Acerbic, weird, and mean in all the right ways—consistently funny.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Tender brutality: family as refuge and trap, quietly gripping.

simulated_ratings.title: Meet the Feebles (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gleefully foul and occasionally clever, but mostly exhausting.

simulated_ratings.title: Voyage to the Sky (1937)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A charming, speculative primer whose curiosity outshines its dated notions.

simulated_ratings.title: Crazy/Beautiful (2001)

simulated_ratings.title: Old Lady and the Pigeons, The (La vieille dame et les pigeons) (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Macabre and witty, a beautifully crafted little fable.

simulated_ratings.title: Cousin Ben Troop Screening (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cute, minor Wes ephemera—amusing while it lasts.

simulated_ratings.title: Issaq (2013)

simulated_ratings.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (2004)

simulated_ratings.title: Early to Bet (1951)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Snappy and clever, a minor trifle that still charms.

simulated_ratings.title: My Brothers and I (2022)
